Speaker: driver
Dialogue: Goddamn bugs.

Speaker: agent janus
Dialogue: Well. Nick the Dick. What a surprise. Where you comin' from?

Speaker: driver
Dialogue: I was fishing in Cuernavaca.

Speaker: agent janus
Dialogue: Sure you were. What do you say we have a look at your catch?

Speaker: agent janus
Dialogue: Me, I woulda thrown 'em back.

Speaker: kay
Dialogue: We'll take it from here.

Speaker: agent janus
Dialogue: Who the hell are you?

Speaker: kay
Dialogue: Really?

Speaker: dee
Dialogue: Tough call, Kay.

Speaker: kay
Dialogue: !Oye! Que pasa, coma estas? Hey!

Speaker: agent janus
Dialogue: Sir!

Speaker: kay
Dialogue: Tomen el camion, y vayeuse.

Speaker: agent janus
Dialogue: Sir, you can't just --

Speaker: kay
Dialogue: Don't "Sir" me! You have no idea who you're dealing with!

Speaker: agent janus
Dialogue: You ever heard of Division 6?

Speaker: kay
Dialogue: I think you jumped off the bus in the wrong part of town, amigo. In fact, I'll bet dollars to pesos that you're not --

Speaker: dee
Dialogue: You know how many treaty articles you've just violated?

Speaker: kay
Dialogue: One, my ass. Try seven.

Speaker: dee
Dialogue: From unauthorized immigration to failure to properly inoculate prior to landing.

Speaker: kay
Dialogue: Okay, that's enough. Hand me your head and put up your arms.

Speaker: agent janus
Dialogue: Th -- th -- th --

Speaker: kay
Dialogue: "That."

Speaker: agent janus
Dialogue: That wasn't -- wasn't -- wasn't --

Speaker: kay
Dialogue: Human, I know. Oops. Got some entrails on you.

Speaker: kay
Dialogue: Okay, everybody, situation's under control, calm down. If you'll just give me your attention for a moment I'll tell you what happened.

Speaker: kay
Dialogue: Exactly the right question. And the answer lies right -- here. Pay attention.

Speaker: janus
Dialogue: Who are you, really?

Speaker: kay
Dialogue: Really? I'm just a figment of your imagination.

Speaker: agent janus
Dialogue: What -- blast?

Speaker: kay
Dialogue: Underground gas vein, genius. You guys need to exercise more caution before discharging your firearms.

Speaker: dee
Dialogue: I'm sorry. About...back there.

Speaker: kay
Dialogue: Happens.

Speaker: dee
Dialogue: Didn't used to.

Speaker: kay
Dialogue: What?

Speaker: dee
Dialogue: The stars. We never just -- look. Anymore.  I'll tell ya, Kay. I will miss the chase.

Speaker: kay
Dialogue: No. You won't.

Speaker: edwards
Dialogue: Stop! NYPD!

Speaker: cop
Dialogue: All yours, Edwards!

Speaker: edwards
Dialogue: Grand Central Station off to your left, folks...

Speaker: edwards
Dialogue: Dammit, man, you're making me sweat up my gear!

Speaker: edwards
Dialogue: Yo, man, your luck just ran out.

Speaker: perp
Dialogue: He's coming! He's coming!

Speaker: edwards
Dialogue: And when he gets here, I'll kick his ass too.

Speaker: edwards
Dialogue: What the...

Speaker: edwards
Dialogue: Wassup?

Speaker: perp
Dialogue: He's coming! He's coming because I failed, and now he'll kill me too!

Speaker: edwards
Dialogue: Stop!

Speaker: perp
Dialogue: You don't understand. Your world is gonna end.

Speaker: edwards
Dialogue: What are you?!

Speaker: inspector
Dialogue: Perpetrator then blinked two sets of eyelids. You mean blinked with both eyes?

Speaker: edwards
Dialogue: No, sir. He blinked once with one set, then again with another completely different set.

Speaker: sergeant
Dialogue: Sort of a low beam, high beam.

Speaker: inspector
Dialogue: Was that before or after he drew the weapon which you claim evaporated into a million pieces?

Speaker: edwards
Dialogue: After, sir.

Speaker: inspector
Dialogue: And why do you suppose none of the other officers saw either of these two events?

Speaker: edwards
Dialogue: 'Cause some of the other officers are a little soggy in the midsection. And they couldn't keep up, sir.

Speaker: sergeant
Dialogue: Hey, Edwards, if you were half the man I am --

Speaker: edwards
Dialogue: What do you mean? I am half the man you are.

Speaker: sergeant
Dialogue: What the hell is your problem?

Speaker: edwards
Dialogue: My problem is you being all up in my damn face all the time.

Speaker: sergeant
Dialogue: I think he threw him off the roof. Ten minutes -- your best shot.

Speaker: inspector
Dialogue: Sergeant. I want to talk to you outside. Now.

Speaker: edwards
Dialogue: You need ten minutes on a Stairmaster, you pudgy bastard.

Speaker: laurel
Dialogue: Laurel Weaver. Deputy Medical Examiner. I believe you. I opened him up. Find me at the morgue. On 26th. I'll tell you what I found.

Speaker: edwards
Dialogue: Hey...Wait a minute. Wait a minute.

Speaker: laurel
Dialogue: You have really pretty eyes.

Speaker: laurel
Dialogue: Yes. That's right.

Speaker: kay
Dialogue: Some night, huh?

Speaker: edwards
Dialogue: Oh, yeah, some night.

Speaker: kay
Dialogue: They were gills.

Speaker: kay
Dialogue: Not eyelids.

Speaker: edwards
Dialogue: Who are you?

Speaker: kay
Dialogue: Did he say anything to you?

Speaker: edwards
Dialogue: Yeah, sure. He said the world was coming to an end.

Speaker: kay
Dialogue: Did he say when?

Speaker: edwards
Dialogue: You're kidding, right?

Speaker: kay
Dialogue: Would you recognize his weapon if you saw it again?

Speaker: edwards
Dialogue: Absolutely.

Speaker: kay
Dialogue: Let's take a ride.

Speaker: edwards
Dialogue: Wait a minute. I got a ton of paperwork.

Speaker: kay
Dialogue: It's all done.

Speaker: inspector
Dialogue: Good work, Edwards.

Speaker: kay
Dialogue: You ran that guy down on foot? That's tough. That's double tough.

Speaker: edwards
Dialogue: So who you with?

Speaker: kay
Dialogue: Nothing is what it seems, kid.

Speaker: edwards
Dialogue: Oh, yeah, my bad '86 Ford LTD. That's a luxury ride. C'mon, who ya with?

Speaker: kay
Dialogue: I'm part of a secret organization that monitors and polices alien activity on earth.

Speaker: edwards
Dialogue: This is where we're going?

Speaker: kay
Dialogue: Really?

Speaker: edwards
Dialogue: All right, you think it's worth shaking him up, fine. I'll do my thing. Then I want some answers.

Speaker: kay
Dialogue: Do your "thing," kid.  Edwards goes inside.

Speaker: jeebs
Dialogue: Officer Edwards. Oh, hey, geez, how'd these get here? I thought I turned 'em in to the proper authorities.

Speaker: edwards
Dialogue: Way I hear it, Jeebs, you into something a little hotter than some stolen Rolexes.

Speaker: jeebs
Dialogue: Sure -- I'm a big crack dealer now. I just work here because I love the hours.

Speaker: edwards
Dialogue: I'm talking about guns, Jeebs. High-tech stuff.

Speaker: jeebs
Dialogue: C'mon, Edwards, whatcha see is what I got.

Speaker: jeebs
Dialogue: H-hiya Kay, how are you?

Speaker: kay
Dialogue: The imports, Jeebs. Now.

Speaker: jeebs
Dialogue: You know I got outta that business a long time ago, Kay.

Speaker: kay
Dialogue: Why do you lie to me? I hate it when you lie.

Speaker: jeebs
Dialogue: Whoa, whoa, Kay, hold on a minute here...

Speaker: kay
Dialogue: I'm going to count to three.

Speaker: edwards
Dialogue: He'll do it, Jeebs.

Speaker: kay
Dialogue: One.

Speaker: edwards
Dialogue: I've seen him do it.

Speaker: kay
Dialogue: Two.

Speaker: edwards
Dialogue: Talk to me, Jeebs, he's crazy when he's like this.

Speaker: jeebs
Dialogue: He's always crazy.  Take a cruise. Get a massage --

Speaker: kay
Dialogue: Three.

Speaker: edwards
Dialogue: Put down the gun and put your hands on the counter!

Speaker: kay
Dialogue: I warned him.

Speaker: edwards
Dialogue: Drop the weapon!

Speaker: kay
Dialogue: You warned him.

Speaker: edwards
Dialogue: You are under arrest. You have the right to remain silent.

Speaker: kay
Dialogue: Will you relax?

Speaker: kay
Dialogue: Show us what you got, Jeebs. Or I'll use up another one.

Speaker: kay
Dialogue: Edwards?

Speaker: edwards
Dialogue: Uh, this. This is what I saw.

Speaker: kay
Dialogue: You sold a carbonizer with implosion capacity to an unlicensed cephlapoid.

Speaker: jeebs
Dialogue: He looked all right to me.

Speaker: kay
Dialogue: A carbonizer is an assassin's weapon, Jeebs. Who was the target?

Speaker: jeebs
Dialogue: I don't know.

Speaker: kay
Dialogue: Jeebs!

Speaker: jeebs
Dialogue: I don't know!

Speaker: kay
Dialogue: This is all confiscated. All of it. I want you on the next transport off this rock. Or I'll shoot you where it doesn't grow back.

Speaker: edwards
Dialogue: Yeah. I'll be by tomorrow for those Rolexes.

Speaker: edwards
Dialogue: The eyelids, fine ... and the jumping thing ... and the gun ... okay, but the head?

Speaker: kay
Dialogue: Searching for a handle on the moment here? A place to file all this.

Speaker: edwards
Dialogue: See a head doesn't do that, it doesn't just grow back.  What's going on?

Speaker: kay
Dialogue: Can't help you, kid. Only comfort I can offer is that tomorrow, you won't remember a thing.

Speaker: edwards
Dialogue: Oh, no. This I'm gonna remember for a long, long time.

Speaker: kay
Dialogue: Ever see one of these?

Speaker: kay
Dialogue: -- and the wife says yeah, Harry, I know, but this one's eating my popcorn!

Speaker: edwards
Dialogue: Huh?

Speaker: kay
Dialogue: Whoops. Gotta run. Thanks for the egg rolls.

Speaker: edwards
Dialogue: Where am I?

Speaker: kay
Dialogue: See what I mean about tequila? You're a bright young man, James. Just lay off the sauce. I'll see you tomorrow, nine a.m. sharp.

Speaker: waitress
Dialogue: Another beer?

Speaker: edwards
Dialogue: Coffee. Please.

Speaker: edgar
Dialogue: Figures.

Speaker: beatrice
Dialogue: What is it, Edgar?!

Speaker: edgar
Dialogue: Get your big butt back in that house!

Speaker: edgar
Dialogue: You can have my gun when you pry it from my cold, dead fingers!

Speaker: beatrice
Dialogue: What on earth was it?!

Speaker: edgar
Dialogue: Sugar.

Speaker: beatrice
Dialogue: I've never seen sugar do that.

Speaker: edgar
Dialogue: Give me sugar.

Speaker: beatrice
Dialogue: Edgar, your skin! It's -- it's -- just hanging off your bones!

Speaker: edgar
Dialogue: That better?

Speaker: guard
Dialogue: Help you?

Speaker: edwards
Dialogue: Maybe, I'm not sure, see, I got this card --

Speaker: guard
Dialogue: Elevator. Push the "call" button.

Speaker: zed
Dialogue: You're late. Sit down.

Speaker: edwards
Dialogue: Why, uh -- I'm sorry, it's just no one really asked this, but -- why, exactly, are we doing this?

Speaker: zed
Dialogue: Son?

Speaker: ambitious recruit
Dialogue: Jake Jensen, West Point, graduate with honors. We're here because you're looking for the best of the best of the best, sir!

Speaker: zed
Dialogue: What's so funny, Edwards?

Speaker: edwards
Dialogue: I -- I don't know, sir. This guy. "Best of the best of the best of the best of the --"  Humorous. Sir.

Speaker: zed
Dialogue: Okay. Let's get going.

Speaker: edwards
Dialogue: Anyone, uh...any of you guys know what we're doing here?

Speaker: marine
Dialogue: Looking for the best of the best of the best.

Speaker: edwards
Dialogue: Well, yeah, I know, but...

Speaker: zed
Dialogue: The hell happened?

Speaker: edwards
Dialogue: Hesitated, sir.

Speaker: zed
Dialogue: May I ask why you felt little Tiffany deserved to die?

Speaker: edwards
Dialogue: She was the only one who actually seemed dangerous. At the time.

Speaker: zed
Dialogue: And how did you come to that conclusion?

Speaker: edwards
Dialogue: Hook-head guy. You explain to me how he can think with a hook for a head. Answer; it's not his head. His head is that butt-ugly bean-bag thing over there. 'Cause if you look at the snarling beast-guy, he's not snarling, he's sneezing -- he's got tissues in his hand. No threat there, and anyhow, the girl's books were way too advanced for an eight-year-old's. And besides, from where I'm looking, she was the only one who appeared to have a motive. And I don't appreciate your jumping down my throat about it.

Speaker: zed
Dialogue: He's got a real problem with authority.

Speaker: kay
Dialogue: So do I. The guy ran down a cephlapoid, Zed. On foot. Tenacity. That I can use.

Speaker: zed
Dialogue: I hope you know what you're doing.

Speaker: edwards
Dialogue: You! Hey, what's goin' on?

Speaker: kay
Dialogue: Back in the mid-fifties, the government started a little underfunded agency with the simple and laughable purpose of making contact with a race not of this planet.

Speaker: zed
Dialogue: Now, if you'll look directly at the end of this device.

Speaker: kay
Dialogue: Everybody thought the agency was a joke. Except the aliens. They made contact on March 2nd, 1961, outside New  York City.

Speaker: edwards
Dialogue: You brought the aliens flowers?

Speaker: kay
Dialogue: They were intergalactic refugees with a simple request. Let us use the earth as an apolitical zone for people without a planet.  Ever see "Casablanca?" Same thing, no Nazis.  We agreed. So we masked all evidence of their landing.

Speaker: edwards
Dialogue: The 1964 World's Fair was a coverup?

Speaker: kay
Dialogue: Why else would we hold it in Queens?  Now left. More nonhumans arrive every year. They live among us, in secret.

Speaker: edwards
Dialogue: I see. Not to change the subject, but when was your last cat-scan?

Speaker: kay
Dialogue: Every six months; it's company policy.

Speaker: edwards
Dialogue: Well, thanks for the very amusing morning, but I'm hopin' you'll show me where I came in?  'Cause this is where I go out.

Speaker: kay
Dialogue: Yeah, sure, hang on, I wanna grab a coffee while we're right here.

Speaker: kay
Dialogue: Any given time, around fifteen hundred landed aliens are on the planet, the majority right here in Manhattan. Most aliens are decent enough, just trying to make a living.

Speaker: edwards
Dialogue: Cab drivers?

Speaker: kay
Dialogue: Not as many as you'd think. Humans, for the most part, don't have a clue. Don't want one, either. They're happy. They think they've got a pretty good bead on things.

Speaker: edwards
Dialogue: Why the big secret? People are smart, they can handle it.

Speaker: kay
Dialogue: A person is smart. People are dumb. Everything they've ever "known" has been proven to be wrong. A thousand years ago everybody knew as a fact, that the earth was the center of the universe. Five hundred years ago, they knew it was flat. Fifteen minutes ago, you knew we humans were alone on it. Imagine what you'll know tomorrow.

Speaker: edwards
Dialogue: So what's the catch?

Speaker: kay
Dialogue: What you'll gain in perspective, you'll lose in ways you're too young to comprehend. You give up everything. Sever every human contact. No one will know you exist. Ever.

Speaker: edwards
Dialogue: Nobody?

Speaker: kay
Dialogue: You're not even allowed a favorite shirt. There.  That's the speech I never heard. That's the choice I never got.

Speaker: edwards
Dialogue: Hold up. You track me down, put me through those stupid-ass tests, now you're trying to talk me out of it. I don't get it.

Speaker: kay
Dialogue: You got 'til sun-up.

Speaker: edwards
Dialogue: Is it worth it?

Speaker: kay
Dialogue: You find out, you let me know.

Speaker: orkin man
Dialogue: Well, well, well. Movin' right in, are we? Think we own the place?

Speaker: orkin man
Dialogue: Takin' care of your pest problem.

Speaker: edgar
Dialogue: "Pest" problem? "Pest?"

Speaker: orkin man
Dialogue: Yeah. You got a hell of an infestation.

Speaker: edgar
Dialogue: You know, I have noticed an infestation here. Everywhere I look, in fact. Nothing but undeveloped, unevolved, barely conscious pond scum. So convinced of their own superiority as they scurry about their short, pointless lives.

Speaker: orkin man
Dialogue: Well -- yeah. Don't you want to get rid of 'em?

Speaker: edgar
Dialogue: In the worst way.

Speaker: edwards
Dialogue: One thing you gotta know right now.

Speaker: edwards
Dialogue: All right. I'm in because there's some next-level shit going on around here, and I'm with that. Before you beam me up, there are a couple of things we need to get straight. You chose me 'cause you recognize the skills. So as of now you can cease with all of that calling me "son" or "kid" or "sport." Cool?

Speaker: kay
Dialogue: Cool, slick. Now about those skills of yours,

Speaker: kay
Dialogue: As of this moment, they don't mean much.

Speaker: passport officer
Dialogue: Purpose of trip?

Speaker: arquillian
Dialogue: Diplomatic mission.

Speaker: passport officer
Dialogue: Duration of stay?

Speaker: arquillian
Dialogue: Lunch.

Speaker: passport officer
Dialogue: Carrying any fruits or vegetables?

Speaker: kay
Dialogue: Let's go. He's a little...grouchy.

Speaker: kay
Dialogue: A couple of hours wait after a 17-light-year flight would get on anybody's nerves.

Speaker: edwards
Dialogue: What branch of the government do we report to?

Speaker: kay
Dialogue: None. They started asking too many questions.

Speaker: edwards
Dialogue: So who pays for all this?

Speaker: kay
Dialogue: Oh, we hold a few patents on gadgets we confiscated from our out-of-state visitors. Velcro. Microwave Ovens. Liposuction.

Speaker: kay
Dialogue: This is amusing. Universal translator.

Speaker: edwards
Dialogue: What's this?

Speaker: edwards
Dialogue: Sorry!

Speaker: kay
Dialogue: Observation, the heart of our little endeavor.

Speaker: edwards
Dialogue: I gotta be honest about something.

Speaker: kay
Dialogue: It makes no sense?

Speaker: edwards
Dialogue: It makes perfect sense. When I was a third grader in Philadelphia, they told me I was crazy 'cause I swore that our teacher was from, like, Venus or something.

Speaker: kay
Dialogue: Mrs. Edelson.

Speaker: kay
Dialogue: Jupiter, actually. Well, one of the moons.

Speaker: zed
Dialogue: What's your jacket size, Edwards?

Speaker: edwards
Dialogue: Uh -- forty regular.

Speaker: zed
Dialogue: Then let's put it on.

Speaker: edwards
Dialogue: Put what on?

Speaker: zed
Dialogue: The last suit you'll ever wear.

Speaker: jay
Dialogue: The difference between you and me?

Speaker: zed
Dialogue: Okay, let's see.  Bee, we got the deposed sur-prefect of Sinalee touching down in the forest outside Portland tonight. I'm pulling you down from Anchorage to do a meet-and-greet.

Speaker: bee
Dialogue: Humanoid?

Speaker: zed
Dialogue: You wish. Bring a sponge.  What else -- everybody, we gotta keep Rolling Fish-Goat out of the sewer system, he's scaring the rats. And Bobo the Squat wants to reveal himself on "Unsolved Mysteries." Bee, make sure he doesn't.

Speaker: zed
Dialogue: Well, well, well -- we got a skimmer.

Speaker: kay
Dialogue: Who is it?

Speaker: zed
Dialogue: Redgick. He's not cleared to leave Manhattan but he's way out of town right now, stuck in traffic on the New Jersey Turnpike. Why don't you take Jay? This is a good one for him to warm up on.

Speaker: jay
Dialogue: Yo, wussup with Zed?  "Go get em, tiger. We're not hosting an intergalactic kegger..."

Speaker: kay
Dialogue: Zed was saving the world before you were born, son. Show some respect.

Speaker: jay
Dialogue: We got the use of unlimited technology from the entire universe and we cruise around in this?

Speaker: kay
Dialogue: Seat belt.

Speaker: jay
Dialogue: You know, ya'll gotta learn how to talk to people. You could be a little kinder and gentler.

Speaker: kay
Dialogue: Buckle up, please.

Speaker: jay
Dialogue: Now did that hurt?

Speaker: kay
Dialogue: Makin' fun of my ride...

Speaker: kay
Dialogue: Jay. The button?

Speaker: jay
Dialogue: Yeah?

Speaker: kay
Dialogue: Never push the button, Jay.

Speaker: kay
Dialogue: License and registration, please.

Speaker: redgick
Dialogue: It's my wife! She's -- she's -- well, look!

Speaker: kay
Dialogue: Oh God. How soon?

Speaker: jay
Dialogue: Me?

Speaker: kay
Dialogue: Sure, it's easy, you just sorta -- catch.

Speaker: redgick
Dialogue: Are you sure he knows what he's doing?

Speaker: kay
Dialogue: Yeah, hell, sure, he does this all the time. C'mon, let him work, Redgick, I wanna ask you something.

Speaker: jay
Dialogue: Oh God! I see it I see it I see it!

Speaker: kay
Dialogue: Croagg the Midwife's back on 64th and 8th. You were headed out of town.

Speaker: redgick
Dialogue: Well, we're, uh -- meeting someone.

Speaker: jay
Dialogue: Oh sweet Jesus Mother of God did you see that?!

Speaker: kay
Dialogue: So? Who you meeting?

Speaker: redgick
Dialogue: Well, it's -- a ship.

Speaker: kay
Dialogue: Really? I didn't see a departure clearance for today.

Speaker: redgick
Dialogue: You didn't? Uh, well -- it was an emergency.

Speaker: jay
Dialogue: Guys -- guys --

Speaker: kay
Dialogue: Doin' fine, Ace.  What kind of emergency? What's the rush to get off the planet all of a sudden?

Speaker: jay
Dialogue: Help?! HELP! Hello?!

Speaker: redgick
Dialogue: We just don't like the neighborhood anymore. Some of the -- new arrivals.

Speaker: kay
Dialogue: What new arrivals? This have anything to do with the crasher from last night?

Speaker: jay
Dialogue: Can you guys do this later?!

Speaker: kay
Dialogue: Congratulations! It's a lizard.

Speaker: jay
Dialogue: Hey, you know, it is sorta --

Speaker: kay
Dialogue: Anything about that seem unusual to you?

Speaker: jay
Dialogue: Pick.

Speaker: kay
Dialogue: What kind of "new arrival" would scare Redgick so bad that he'd risk a warp jump with a newborn?  Let's check the hot sheets.

Speaker: jay
Dialogue: These are the hot sheets?

Speaker: kay
Dialogue: Best damn investigative reporting on the planet.  But hey, go ahead, read the New York Times if you want. They get lucky sometimes.

Speaker: jay
Dialogue: You're actually looking for tips in a supermarket tabloid?

Speaker: kay
Dialogue: Not looking for. Found.

Speaker: kay
Dialogue: Not so fast. Walk up slow.

Speaker: jay
Dialogue: Why?

Speaker: kay
Dialogue: Part of the routine. Makes it look like we're sizing up the situation. Gives her time to get the wrong impression.

Speaker: beatrice
Dialogue: Can I help you gentlemen?

Speaker: kay
Dialogue: How do you do, ma'am, I'm Special Agent Manheim, this is Agent Black, FBI. Had a few questions about your visitor.

Speaker: beatrice
Dialogue: Are you here to make fun of me too?

Speaker: kay
Dialogue: No ma'am. We at the FBI don't have a sense of humor that we're aware of. Mind if we come in?

Speaker: beatrice
Dialogue: Sure. Lemonade?

Speaker: beatrice
Dialogue: And they said to me, "If he was murdered, how could he walk back in the house?" And I must admit, I was a little stumped by that one. But I know Edgar. And that wasn't him. It was more like something else that was wearing him. Like a suit. An Edgar suit.

Speaker: jay
Dialogue: Damn. If he was this ugly before he was an alien...

Speaker: beatrice
Dialogue: Sorry?

Speaker: kay
Dialogue: Go on.

Speaker: beatrice
Dialogue: Anyway, when I came to, he was gone.

Speaker: kay
Dialogue: Did he say anything?

Speaker: beatrice
Dialogue: Yes! He asked for water. Sugar water, if I remember.

Speaker: kay
Dialogue: Sugar water.

Speaker: jay
Dialogue: Did you taste her lemonade?

Speaker: kay
Dialogue: Ray Bans.  Okay, Beatrice. There was no alien, and the flash of light you saw in the sky wasn't a UFO. Swamp gas from a weather balloon was trapped in a thermal pocket and refracted the light from Venus --

Speaker: jay
Dialogue: Whoa! That thing erases her memory, and you give her a new one?

Speaker: kay
Dialogue: Standard issue neuralyzer.

Speaker: jay
Dialogue: And that's the best you can come up with?

Speaker: kay
Dialogue: On a more personal note, Beatrice, Edgar ran off with on old girlfriend. Go stay at your mother's for a few days and get over it. Decide you're better off.

Speaker: jay
Dialogue: Yeah, and you're better off 'cause he never appreciated you anyway. In fact, you kicked him out, and now that he's gone, you ought to buy some new clothes, maybe hire a decorator or something...

Speaker: jay
Dialogue: Hey. Kay...when am I gonna get one of those memory things?

Speaker: kay
Dialogue: When you're ready.  Please -- not green.

Speaker: jay
Dialogue: Wait -- don't tell me -- that was the question on Final Jeopardy last night.

Speaker: kay
Dialogue: Zed, we have a bug.

Speaker: jay
Dialogue: I'm gonna jump way past you and just guess that this is bad. Right?

Speaker: kay
Dialogue: Bugs thrive on carnage, Tiger.  They consume, infest and destroy. They live off the death and decay of other species.

Speaker: jay
Dialogue: So basically you have a racial problem with all insect-based life forms?

Speaker: kay
Dialogue: Listen, kid -- imagine a giant cockroach five times smarter than Albert Einstein, four times stronger than an ox, nine times meaner than hell, strutting his stuff around Manhattan Island in his brand new Edgar suit. Does that sound like fun?

Speaker: jay
Dialogue: What do we do?

Speaker: kay
Dialogue: With a bug in town? Watch the morgues.

Speaker: rosenberg
Dialogue: Sorry I'm late. The cab drivers on this planet are terrible.

Speaker: arquillian
Dialogue: Your majesty, you are in grave danger.

Speaker: rosenberg
Dialogue: Yeah, and they overcharge you every time.

Speaker: arquillian
Dialogue: Sir, a bug landed here. We must get you off the planet.

Speaker: rosenberg
Dialogue: A bug? He must know why I'm here.

Speaker: arquillian
Dialogue: We think he does.  Is that what I think it is?

Speaker: rosenberg
Dialogue: No, just some diamonds for your children. Do we have time to eat?

Speaker: arquillian
Dialogue: Sure. I ordered you some pirogi.

Speaker: cook
Dialogue: Table six is up!

Speaker: arquillian
Dialogue: To the continued reign of the Arquillian Empire.

Speaker: rosenberg
Dialogue: To the safety of the galaxy.

Speaker: rosenberg
Dialogue: You can kill us both -- but you will not find it.

Speaker: edgar
Dialogue: You're right about one thing.

Speaker: cop
Dialogue: What am I supposed to do with the cat?

Speaker: inspector
Dialogue: I don't know. Send it with the stiff. Let family claim it.

Speaker: cop
Dialogue: Where do you want contestant number three?

Speaker: laurel
Dialogue: By the wall, I guess.  What's with the cat?

Speaker: cop
Dialogue: Oh, the cat. There's a problem with the cat. Sign here.

Speaker: laurel
Dialogue: What's the problem with the cat?

Speaker: cop
Dialogue: Your problem.

Speaker: laurel
Dialogue: Are you having a bad day, baby?  Cheer up.  His is worse.

Speaker: laurel
Dialogue: Oh, my God.

Speaker: laurel
Dialogue: ...approximately 112 degrees at time of autopsy, indicating, quite impossibly, a post-mortem increase in body temperature. Examiner attempted to verify result rectally, only to find subject was, uh, without rectum. Which can only be described as...well...as really...

Speaker: laurel
Dialogue: Yeah, well whoever you are, I'm afraid I'm going to need to see some ID.

Speaker: laurel
Dialogue: You boys must not have much of a home life.

Speaker: kay
Dialogue: We watch the morgues very carefully. You've got something unusual?

Speaker: laurel
Dialogue: I'd say so -- triple homicide.

Speaker: kay
Dialogue: I'll have a look at this one. Dr. White, why don't you and Dr. Weaver check out the other body?

Speaker: laurel
Dialogue: This way, Doctor.

Speaker: jay
Dialogue: I think, uh, we should start at the same place you did.

Speaker: laurel
Dialogue: All right.

Speaker: jay
Dialogue: Your cat?

Speaker: laurel
Dialogue: Guess it is now. Came in with the bodies.

Speaker: jay
Dialogue: Thank-you, but is this really the time to uh -- you know, come on to me?

Speaker: laurel
Dialogue: Hey, just walking the dog.  Feel that? Where the piloric junction would be?

Speaker: jay
Dialogue: Oh, yes. Exactly.

Speaker: laurel
Dialogue: Now push that aside. Notice anything strange? Stomach? Liver? Lungs?

Speaker: jay
Dialogue: Nope. All fine.

Speaker: laurel
Dialogue: Doctor, they're all missing.

Speaker: jay
Dialogue: Well, of course they are. What I'm pointing out is that there are no pieces of them left. So they're intact, wherever they are. That we can be sure of.

Speaker: laurel
Dialogue: Have we met before? I have the strangest feeling of deja vu.

Speaker: jay
Dialogue: You know, I was just going to ask you the same thing.

Speaker: laurel
Dialogue: Okay. You wanna know what I really think?  This body is not really a body, but it's actually some sort of transport unit for something else altogether. The question is: what?

Speaker: laurel
Dialogue: By the way, stop me if I'm freaking you out.

Speaker: jay
Dialogue: No, no...not at all.

Speaker: laurel
Dialogue: You know what I like to do sometimes? When it's really late?

Speaker: jay
Dialogue: No...

Speaker: kay
Dialogue: What do you think?

Speaker: jay
Dialogue: Very interesting. Got a real Queen of the Undead thing goin' on.

Speaker: kay
Dialogue: Of the body.

Speaker: jay
Dialogue: Great body.

Speaker: kay
Dialogue: The dead body?

Speaker: jay
Dialogue: Not a clue.

Speaker: kay
Dialogue: All right. Keep her occupied. Try not to sound too dumb.

Speaker: laurel
Dialogue: Dr. White.

Speaker: kay
Dialogue: You're up, Slugger.

Speaker: laurel
Dialogue: Look at this.

Speaker: jay
Dialogue: What is that?

Speaker: laurel
Dialogue: Far -- freaking -- out.

Speaker: baltian
Dialogue: Must -- to pre -- prevent --  -- contest? No...to prevent --

Speaker: jay
Dialogue: It's all right -- What are you trying to say? Struggle?

Speaker: laurel
Dialogue: War?

Speaker: baltian
Dialogue: What is word? Be...?

Speaker: jay
Dialogue: Bed? Belt? Orion's Belt?

Speaker: laurel
Dialogue: "Doctor Whatever"? You're not with the Department of Public Health, are you?

Speaker: jay
Dialogue: He's dead.

Speaker: kay
Dialogue: Rosenberg. Damn. Good man.

Speaker: jay
Dialogue: You knew him?

Speaker: kay
Dialogue: One of the few I actually liked. Exiled High Prince.

Speaker: laurel
Dialogue: I was right -- this is an alien life form, and you're from some government agency who wants to keep it under wraps...

Speaker: jay
Dialogue: He said "to prevent war, the galaxy is on Orion's Belt."

Speaker: laurel
Dialogue: ... This make total sense. How else do you explain New York? The other night I'm in a cab, this guy...

Speaker: kay
Dialogue: He said there's a galaxy on Orion's Belt? That makes no sense.

Speaker: jay
Dialogue: That's what he said.  Oh, for Christ's sake, you did the flashy thing already.

Speaker: laurel
Dialogue: Uh, hi, whoever you guys are, I'm afraid I'm going to need to see some ID if you're going to be in the morgue, okay?

Speaker: kay
Dialogue: Sure thing, sweetheart. Here you go.

Speaker: jay
Dialogue: Stop that --

Speaker: kay
Dialogue: Typical day, too much caffeine, get a life.

Speaker: jay
Dialogue: -- that thing probably gives you brain cancer!

Speaker: kay
Dialogue: Never hurt her before.

Speaker: jay
Dialogue: "Never hurt her before"?! How many times have you done the flashy thing to this poor woman?!

Speaker: kay
Dialogue: Couple.

Speaker: jay
Dialogue: Aren't you worried about, you know, long term damage?

Speaker: kay
Dialogue: Little bit.

Speaker: jay
Dialogue: What the hell happened to make you such a callous son of a bitch?

Speaker: kay
Dialogue: I took this job.

Speaker: jay
Dialogue: Hey, you never flashed me with that thing, did you?

Speaker: kay
Dialogue: Nah.

Speaker: jay
Dialogue: Hey, Kay, I really think I should be in charge of the flashy memory thing department.

Speaker: kay
Dialogue: Not while I'm around, Slim.

Speaker: jay
Dialogue: Yeah, well you're a menace with that thing...

Speaker: kay
Dialogue: We've got two dead aliens in there, and a deputy medical coroner in need of a new memory.

Speaker: edgar
Dialogue: No. No, NO, NO, NOOOO!

Speaker: jay
Dialogue: Doesn't anybody believe in sleep around here?

Speaker: zed
Dialogue: The twins keep us on Alpha Centaurian time -- a 37-hour day. Give it a few months -- you'll get used to it. Or you'll have a psychotic episode.

Speaker: zed
Dialogue: Here's Orion; the brightest grouping of stars in the northern sky...  and here's Orion's belt --

Speaker: jay
Dialogue: That's what the little guy was talking about, "To prevent war, the galaxy's on Orion's belt..."

Speaker: zed
Dialogue: There are no galaxies on Orion's belt. The belt is just these three stars; galaxies are huge, made up of billions of stars.  You heard wrong.

Speaker: jay
Dialogue: You're attracted to me, aren't you?

Speaker: jay
Dialogue: Pretty lady...

Speaker: kay
Dialogue: No.

Speaker: jay
Dialogue: Well, it's better to have loved and lost than never to have --

Speaker: kay
Dialogue: Try it.

Speaker: kay
Dialogue: They're leaving.

Speaker: zed
Dialogue: We've had twelve jumps in the last hour. Redgick was just the beginning.

Speaker: jay
Dialogue: What do they know that we don't know?

Speaker: kay
Dialogue: Why do rats desert the ship?  Go to Lem Sat IV. Put up a forty-field view of Manhattan.

Speaker: jay
Dialogue: And we've got a dead Arquillian prince.

Speaker: kay
Dialogue: Message coming in.

Speaker: jay
Dialogue: They sound pissed.

Speaker: zed
Dialogue: Meanwhile get down to Rosenberg's store and see what you can turn up.

Speaker: jay
Dialogue: I like that.

Speaker: kay
Dialogue: Series four de-atomizer.

Speaker: jay
Dialogue: You get a series four de-atomizer and I get a "Noisy Cricket?!"  I'm afraid I'm going to break it.

Speaker: edgar
Dialogue: That's my truck!

Speaker: driver
Dialogue: And make sure you tell them that at the impound.

Speaker: jay
Dialogue: Who robs a jewelry store and leaves the jewels?

Speaker: kay
Dialogue: Someone who's not looking for jewels.

Speaker: jay
Dialogue: This guy had a serious crush on his cat.

Speaker: jay
Dialogue: Kay! GET DOWN!

Speaker: jay
Dialogue: The bug in the Edgar suit! The ugly redneck from the picture! That's him!

Speaker: kay
Dialogue: Damn it.

Speaker: kay
Dialogue: We do not discharge our weapons in view of the public.

Speaker: jay
Dialogue: Can we drop the cover-up bullshit?! There's an Alien Battle Cruiser that's gonna blow-up the world if we don't...

Speaker: kay
Dialogue: There's always an Alien Battle Cruiser...or a Korlian Death Ray, or...an intergalactic plague about to wipe out life on this planet, and the only thing that lets people get on with their hopeful little lives is that they don't know about it.

Speaker: kay
Dialogue: Don't worry about the bug. He's not leaving town. We've got his ship.

Speaker: kay
Dialogue: Zed, we're gonna need a containment crew down here at McDougal, south of Houston.

Speaker: zed
Dialogue: Containment may be a moot point, my friend. The exodus continues. It's like the party's over and the last one to leave gets stuck with the check.

Speaker: zed
Dialogue: You sorry little ingrates!

Speaker: zed
Dialogue: We've only translated a part of the message so far: "Deliver the Galaxy."

Speaker: zed
Dialogue: Oh, it gets better... They're holding us responsible.

Speaker: zed
Dialogue: Another contestant has entered the ring.

Speaker: kay
Dialogue: All right, kid. The Arquillians want the galaxy, whatever the hell that means. We need help. A professional. Someone with years of experience in intergalactic politics. I just hope the little prick hasn't skipped town.

Speaker: edgar
Dialogue: Where do you keep your dead?

Speaker: vendor
Dialogue: I don't have any dead.

Speaker: edgar
Dialogue: Where?!

Speaker: vendor
Dialogue: I don't know, the city morgue!

Speaker: jay
Dialogue: Of course that guy's an alien. That's gotta be the worst disguise I've ever seen.

Speaker: kay
Dialogue: You busy, Frank?

Speaker: kay
Dialogue: Call the pound. We got a stray.

Speaker: jay
Dialogue: The, uh...dog owes my friend some money.

Speaker: kay
Dialogue: Arquillians and bugs. What do you know?

Speaker: kay
Dialogue: Not a thing?

Speaker: kay
Dialogue: And the bug had other plans.

Speaker: jay
Dialogue: Ask him about the belt.

Speaker: kay
Dialogue: Rosenberg said something about a galaxy on "Orion's belt." What's he talking about, Frank?

Speaker: jay
Dialogue: They're rehearsing a ventriloquist act.

Speaker: kay
Dialogue: Here?

Speaker: jay
Dialogue: The galaxy is hundreds of millions of stars and planets? How's it here?

Speaker: kay
Dialogue: How small?

Speaker: kay
Dialogue: The galaxy's here. It's not on Orion's belt.

Speaker: jay
Dialogue: Kay...

Speaker: laurel
Dialogue: Boy, when you want attention --

Speaker: laurel
Dialogue: Wow.

Speaker: jay
Dialogue: So two galaxies have been fighting for years. And the only people who've been benefiting are a race of creatures called bugs. Then the two galaxies decide to make peace...and the bugs send this guy down to make sure the fighting never stops.

Speaker: kay
Dialogue: By killing the emissaries, and stealing the galaxy they've been fighting about.

Speaker: jay
Dialogue: And if we don't get it back before he leaves the planet...we're history.

Speaker: kay
Dialogue: We're not even history. 'Cause history implies there's someone around to remember it.

Speaker: tony
Dialogue: Thank you for making sure the bell works.

Speaker: edgar
Dialogue: A man came in here earlier. A dead man.

Speaker: tony
Dialogue: And this means what to me?

Speaker: edgar
Dialogue: He was a very dear friend of mine. And I believe he had an animal with him. A gift I gave him, a pet cat that means worlds to me. I would like it back.

Speaker: tony
Dialogue: I'll need a picture ID, written proof of ownership of the cat, or notarized proof of kinship with --

Speaker: edgar
Dialogue: Don't -- do that.

Speaker: tony
Dialogue: Do what?

Speaker: jay
Dialogue: I'll handle this one, you wait outside.

Speaker: kay
Dialogue: What the hell for?

Speaker: jay
Dialogue: Because all we have to do is walk in and get a cat, it's not that hard. But if you go in, you're gonna lay your Jack Webb on her and flash your brain ray in her face and she's gonna end up with leukemia or some shit. The woman's a doctor, she doesn't need you erasing half her med school classes. Take me five minutes.

Speaker: kay
Dialogue: Two minutes!

Speaker: edgar
Dialogue: Where is the animal?!

Speaker: laurel
Dialogue: I told you, I don't know, it ran under some equipment! Over there.

Speaker: edgar
Dialogue: Get it!

Speaker: jay
Dialogue: Uh, hi.

Speaker: laurel
Dialogue: Hello.

Speaker: jay
Dialogue: I'm Sergeant Friday, from the Twenty-Sixth precinct. They brought a cat in here with a corpse the other day, might have said "Orion" on the cat's name tag?

Speaker: laurel
Dialogue: Yes. That's right.

Speaker: jay
Dialogue: Right, well, the cat is, uh -- the cat's a witness in a murder case and I'm going to need to take it with me.

Speaker: laurel
Dialogue: I don't know where the cat is at the moment.

Speaker: jay
Dialogue: You don't?

Speaker: laurel
Dialogue: No.  Maybe you could take me with you instead.

Speaker: jay
Dialogue: Excuse me?

Speaker: laurel
Dialogue: I said, maybe you could take me with you instead.

Speaker: jay
Dialogue: Damn, you do start fast, don't you?

Speaker: laurel
Dialogue: I'd really like to go with you. Now.

Speaker: jay
Dialogue: And, uh, why exactly is that?

Speaker: laurel
Dialogue: I just do.

Speaker: laurel
Dialogue: I have something I need to show you.

Speaker: jay
Dialogue: Now slow down, you don't have to hit the gas like that.

Speaker: laurel
Dialogue: You don't understand. You really need to see this.

Speaker: jay
Dialogue: And I will. But we gotta get something straight here -- I'm gonna drive. It's not some kind of macho trip, it's just the way I'm used to doing things, okay?

Speaker: laurel
Dialogue: Look, Stud, I don't know how many more times I'm going to get to tell you this. There's something --

Speaker: kay
Dialogue: Freeze it, Bug!

Speaker: jay
Dialogue: Don't shoot! Don't shoot!

Speaker: laurel
Dialogue: CHRIST, are you THICK!

Speaker: jay
Dialogue: How was I supposed to know!?!

Speaker: laurel
Dialogue: What did I have to do, SING it for you!?!

Speaker: jay
Dialogue: Maybe if you didn't come on like a drunken prom date!

Speaker: laurel
Dialogue: Oh, that's SO typical. Any time a woman shows the slightest hint of sexual independence, men just --

Speaker: edgar
Dialogue: Everybody shut UP!

Speaker: kay
Dialogue: Let her go, Shit Eater.

Speaker: edgar
Dialogue: Listen, Monkey Boy, I may have to take that kind of talk in my end of the universe, but compared to you humans, I'm the top rung on the evolutionary ladder, so can it, all right?!

Speaker: kay
Dialogue: You're breakin' my heart. Move six inches to your left and I'll solve all your problems.

Speaker: edgar
Dialogue: That's better. Now put down your weapons. We're leaving.

Speaker: kay
Dialogue: How far you think you'll get without your ship? If that's what you call that hunk of space crap we've got back at our office.

Speaker: edgar
Dialogue: Put the weapons down!

Speaker: kay
Dialogue: Never gonna happen, Insect.

Speaker: jay
Dialogue: It's okay, Laurel!

Speaker: laurel
Dialogue: HOW is it okay?!

Speaker: jay
Dialogue: I mean it's going to be okay!

Speaker: edgar
Dialogue: Don't bet on it, meat sack.

Speaker: kay
Dialogue: Damn it!

Speaker: edgar
Dialogue: Take me here.

Speaker: laurel
Dialogue: What???

Speaker: jay
Dialogue: They're in a cab.

Speaker: jay
Dialogue: Hey! Laurel!? Hey!

Speaker: kay
Dialogue: Stop wasting time. He's not getting off the planet in a cab.

Speaker: kay
Dialogue: Come with me. Put up a bio-net all the way around Manhattan; if it's not human, it's not leaving the island.

Speaker: zed
Dialogue: Same thing: "Deliver the galaxy."

Speaker: kay
Dialogue: Yeah, well the bug's got the galaxy, but we've got his ship. He's got to be looking for a way out.

Speaker: jay
Dialogue: WHAT THE HELL ARE THEY SHOOTING AT US FOR?!

Speaker: zed
Dialogue: Arquillian battle rules, kid. First we get an ultimatum, then a warning shot, then we have a galactic standard week to respond.

Speaker: jay
Dialogue: A galactic standard week? How the hell long is that?

Speaker: kay
Dialogue: One hour.

Speaker: jay
Dialogue: One hour?

Speaker: zed
Dialogue: To keep the bugs from getting it, the Arquillians will destroy the galaxy and whatever planet it's on.

Speaker: jay
Dialogue: You're talking about US!

Speaker: zed
Dialogue: Sucks, doesn't it?

Speaker: kay
Dialogue: Pull up the locations of all land-based interstellar vehicles.

Speaker: zed
Dialogue: They're all gone. Frank the Pug took the last ship on the planet.

Speaker: kay
Dialogue: Atlantic City?

Speaker: zed
Dialogue: Gone.

Speaker: kay
Dialogue: That landfill on the Jersey Shore?

Speaker: zed
Dialogue: Gone.

Speaker: jay
Dialogue: Uh, gentlemen.

Speaker: kay
Dialogue: Epcot?

Speaker: zed
Dialogue: Gone.

Speaker: kay
Dialogue: Miami Beach?

Speaker: zed
Dialogue: Gone.

Speaker: jay
Dialogue: Fellas.

Speaker: kay
Dialogue: Hartford?

Speaker: zed
Dialogue: Gone, thank God.

Speaker: jay
Dialogue: Hey. Old guys.

Speaker: edgar
Dialogue: You're coming with me.

Speaker: laurel
Dialogue: What?! Why?!

Speaker: edgar
Dialogue: It's a long trip. I'll need a snack.

Speaker: kay
Dialogue: Whaddya say we bag us some bug?

Speaker: jay
Dialogue: You're taking the tunnel?!

Speaker: kay
Dialogue: You know a better way to Queens?

Speaker: jay
Dialogue: It's usually jammed?!

Speaker: jay
Dialogue: I told you!

Speaker: kay
Dialogue: Jay. The button?

Speaker: jay
Dialogue: Yeah?!

Speaker: kay
Dialogue: Push the button, Jay.

Speaker: kay
Dialogue: Mind if I smoke?

Speaker: jay
Dialogue: What?!?

Speaker: kay
Dialogue: In the car, I mean.

Speaker: jay
Dialogue: I don't care!!

Speaker: kay
Dialogue: Hey, just a common courtesy. It bothers some people if you smoke in a car.

Speaker: kay
Dialogue: Yeah, it's harder and harder to smoke anywhere these days. Hell, I suppose I should quit. I've tried. Never took, though. I'm beginning to think I lack self-control.

Speaker: kay
Dialogue: Well, back to work.

Speaker: laurel
Dialogue: Come on, let me go, you don't want to eat me. I'm a very important person on my planet. Like a queen. A goddess, even. There are those who worship me, yes. I'm not trying to impress you with this, I'm just letting you know. It could start a war.

Speaker: edgar
Dialogue: Good. War means food for my family, all seventy-eight million of them. That's a lot of mouths to feed, your highness.

Speaker: laurel
Dialogue: You're a wonderful dad.

Speaker: jay
Dialogue: You know how to work that?

Speaker: kay
Dialogue: No idea whatsoever.

Speaker: jay
Dialogue: Oh, shit.

Speaker: kay
Dialogue: Set it to pulsar level five, sub-sonic implosion factor --

Speaker: jay
Dialogue: What?

Speaker: kay
Dialogue: Press the little green button, on three.

Speaker: edgar
Dialogue: You don't get it. I've won. It's over.

Speaker: kay
Dialogue: You are under arrest for violating number 4-1-53 of the Tycho accord. Please hand over any galaxy you might be carrying.

Speaker: edgar
Dialogue: You milk-suckers! You don't matter! In a few seconds you won't even be matter!

Speaker: kay
Dialogue: Move away from the vehicle and put your hands on your head.

Speaker: edgar
Dialogue: Put my hands on my head?

Speaker: bug
Dialogue: Like this?

Speaker: jay
Dialogue: That did not go at all like I had planned.

Speaker: kay
Dialogue: This guy's really starting to bug me.

Speaker: kay
Dialogue: Whatever happens, Jay, don't let him get on that ship.

Speaker: jay
Dialogue: Where are you going?

Speaker: kay
Dialogue: Getting my gun back.

Speaker: jay
Dialogue: What!?

Speaker: kay
Dialogue: You're just a smear on the sports page to me, you slimy, gut-sucking, intestinal parasite! Eat me!

Speaker: jay
Dialogue: Hey! Come over here and try that!

Speaker: jay
Dialogue: Stop right there, or I'll start wailing on your waxy, pointed ass!

Speaker: jay
Dialogue: What are you, afraid of me? Come on! Stand and fight like an arthropod!

Speaker: jay
Dialogue: You're messing with the wrong species, Bug --

Speaker: jay
Dialogue: Hey, Bug!

Speaker: jay
Dialogue: What's that? Can you hear what he's saying? 'Help me! Help me!'

Speaker: jay
Dialogue: Ooh! There's a pretty one. That one looks kinda familiar, don't you think? I know who that is!

Speaker: bug
Dialogue: Don't do that!

Speaker: jay
Dialogue: That's your Momma!

Speaker: jay
Dialogue: You son of a --

Speaker: kay
Dialogue: Zed. Get a message to the Arquillians.  We have the galaxy.

Speaker: zed
Dialogue: I think the word's already out. Our friends are coming back.  Got an authorized landing at Times Square. You and Jay check it out on the way back... And pick me up one of those soft pretzels, while you're at it. Extra salt. I feel like celebrating.

Speaker: kay
Dialogue: You were saying?

Speaker: jay
Dialogue: Getting eaten!? That was your plan!?

Speaker: kay
Dialogue: Worked.

Speaker: jay
Dialogue: After I got the shit beat out of me!

Speaker: kay
Dialogue: And I almost got digested. It goes with the job.

Speaker: jay
Dialogue: You coulda told me what you were doing.

Speaker: kay
Dialogue: There wasn't time, sport!

Speaker: laurel
Dialogue: Interesting job you guys got.

Speaker: driver
Dialogue: Damn bugs.

Speaker: jay
Dialogue: Look, I know we got rules, but she did just bust the Bug for us.  And so maybe you don't have to flashy thing her.

Speaker: jay
Dialogue: Who's she gonna tell, anyway? She only hangs out with dead people.

Speaker: kay
Dialogue: Not her. Me.  They're beautiful, aren't they? The stars. I never just look anymore and they're beautiful.

Speaker: jay
Dialogue: Kay, you're scaring your partner.

Speaker: kay
Dialogue: I haven't been training a partner -- I've been training a replacement.

Speaker: jay
Dialogue: Oh no, I can't do this job by myself.

Speaker: laurel
Dialogue: Hey, guys, we're nowhere near my apartment. We're not even on the right island.

Speaker: kay
Dialogue: Maybe you won't have to.

Speaker: kay
Dialogue: Days. Months. Years. Always face it forwards.

Speaker: kay
Dialogue: I've just been down the gullet of an interstellar cockroach. That's one of a hundred memories I don't want.

Speaker: kay
Dialogue: See you around, sport.

Speaker: jay
Dialogue: No, you won't.

Speaker: elle
Dialogue: Zed called. The High Consulate of Regent-9 emissary wants floor seats to the Knicks -- Bulls game.

Speaker: jay
Dialogue: I'll talk to Dennis Rodman, it's his damn planet.

Speaker: elle
Dialogue: Let's roll.
